item.title: Full 2025 Steam Sales Schedule Revealed by Valve
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/full-2025-steam-sales-schedule-revealed-by-valve/

Valve has officially confirmed the full schedule of Steam Sales and Festivals for the remainder of 2025. A full slate of Steam events have been announced for the entire year, guaranteeing that waves of discounts and bundles will never subside. The first half of 2025 sales events were announced in July 2024.

The 2025 schedule features the major seasonal Sales, genre-specific Fests, and Next Fests highlighting upcoming titles. Valve has noted that this year’s Autumn Sale will be at “a different time frame compared to previous Autumn Sales.”

All 2025 Steam Sales and Festivals

  • Couch Co-Op Fest: February 10 – 17
  • Steam Next Fest – February 2025 Edition: February 24 – March 3
  • Visual Novel Fest: March 3 – 10
  • 2025 Steam Spring Sale: March 13 – 20
  • City Builder & Colony Sim Fest: March 24 – 31
  • Sokoban Fest: April 21 – 28
  • Wargames Fest: April 28 – May 5
  • Creature Collector Fest: May 12 – 19
  • Zombies vs. Vampires Fest: May 26 – June 2
  • Steam Next Fest – June 2025 Edition: June 9 – 16
  • Fishing Fest: June 16 – 23
  • Steam Summer Sale: June 26 – July 10
  • Automation Fest: July 14 – 21
  • Racing Fest: July 28 – August 4
  • 4X Fest: August 11 – 18
  • Third Person Shooter (TPS) Fest: August 25 – September 1
  • Political Sim Fest: September 8 – 15
  • Steam Autumn Sale: September 29 – October 6 
  • Steam Next Fest – October 2025 Edition: October 13 – 20
  • Steam Scream 4: October 27 – November 3
  • Animal Fest: November 10 – 17
  • Sports Fest: December 8 – December 15
  • Steam Winter Sale: December 18 – January 5

Valve provided some insight on their scheduling via their 2025 second half announcement. The Fests are centered around “a rotating category of games,” with dates set well in advance for developers to have time to plan their participation. Back in 2021, Valve wrote that daily wishlist additions jumped 421% during the 2020 Next Fest, resulting in a an increase of 292% in “converting wishlists” sales. While gaming sales number in general were incredibly inflated during the first year of COVID, this still demonstrates how important Steam Sales and Fests are to selling games.

item.title: Marvel Rivals to Host $400,000 Global Invitational Tournament
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/marvel-rivals-to-host-400000-global-invitational-tournament/

NetEase has announced the biggest and most lucrative Marvel Rivals tournament series to date. The Marvel Rivals Invitational will see teams across the world compete in one of four regional tournaments, with $400,000 on the line across the whole series.

Could this be the first major step toward a serious Marvel Rivals esports scene?

Marvel Rivals Invitational Announced

The Marvel Rivals Invitational will consist of four separate tournaments, one for each major region. Each region’s tournament will feature its own $100,000 prize pool, meaning a total of $400,000 will be given out across the five week span. The Marvel Rivals Invitational will begin with the Oceanic tournament, then Asia, then EMEA, and finally North America.

The matches will be broadcast on both the official Marvel Rivals Twitch channel and YouTube channel. Here are the dates for each region:

  • Oceania – February 15-16
  • Asia – February 22-23
  • EMEA – February 28-March 2, March 7-9
  • North America – March 14-16, March 21-23

NetEase and Marvel Rivals have been hesitant to jump head first into a dedicated esports scene. Many point to the rushed creation of the Overwatch League as something that did more harm than good, as OWL was announced the same year that Overwatch released. Back in January 2025, Marvel Rivals game director Guangyun Chen said that he wanted to cater to both casual and competitive players. As of now, Marvel Rivals is not rushing to put together a massive esports league.

Still, there’s been no shortage of interest in a potential esports scene. Streaming star Shroud mentioned potentially starting an organization just to play Marvel Rivals back in January. He then confirmed that he’s building an organization after reaching a $150,000 donation goal during a charity stream a month later. He also met with Sentinels CEO Rob Moore, who said he would be open to Shroud running a Marvel Rivals team under the Sentinels brand.

Is a tournament of this size going to ignite the Marvel Rivals esports scene ?Let us know in the comments or on the community forum!

item.title: Assassin’s Creed Shadows Preorders In Line With Odyssey
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/assassins-creed-shadows-preorders-in-line-with-odyssey/

Ubisoft is happy with the pre-launch build for Assassin’s Creed Shadows. Despite multiple delays that pushed the game out of 2024 to March 20, 2025, Ubisoft’s CEO Yves Guillemot says that the interest in the game has seen strong preorders overall.

During Ubisoft’s Q3 2025 earnings call on Thursday, Guillemot said that preorders for Assassin’s Creed Shadows are “tracking solidly, in line with those of Assassin’s Creed Odyssey, the second most successful entry of the franchise”.

Aside from the pre-orders, Ubisoft says that the previews of the game have been strong from multiple angles.

“Early previews have been positive, praising its narrative and immersive experience, with both characters playing critical roles in the game’s storyline, as well as the quality and complementarity of the gameplay provided by the dual protagonist approach,” Guillemot said.

He continued: “I want to commend the incredible talent and dedication of the entire Assassin’s Creed’s team, who is working tirelessly to ensure that Shadows delivers on the promise of what is the franchise’s most ambitious entry yet.”

Assassin’s Creed Shadows was originally scheduled for release on November 15, 2024. The game was then delayed to February 14, 2025 for more polish and updates. In January, it was delayed again to March 20.
